page.title: 08FARM VISIT,POSBURY CONTD.
page.content: cows,there were eight of them and the next day they were going to market.They had an earring to keep the flies away.Off we walked to see a lamb and a billy goat.The lamb had a disease called orf(sores around his mouth).There were also these old barns that once were part of the Shelley estate.We went as close to the billy goat as we dared.He was a very ferocious and he had hose pipe on his horns just so he can't buck and hurt you.We went back to the farm to get our bags and things.Off we walked to Demmits farm.We came through the farm and looked at the barns one was to keep cows and bulloks and it could fit 36 in.There were little places where they put their heads through to feed.In the winter they stay in the barn.Mr Pope has to keep food for them,so they cut grass in the summer
